q: The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.
h:
“The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.” —
Aristotle

q: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
h:
“Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
h:
“Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.” —
Mahatma Gandhi

q: Don't take yourself too seriously, pretty soon you can find the humor in our everyday lives.
h:
“Don't take yourself too seriously, pretty soon you can find the humor in our everyday lives.” —
Betty White

q: Strategy without tactics is the slowest route to victory. Tactics without strategy is the noise before defeat.
h:
“Strategy without tactics is the slowest route to victory. Tactics without strategy is the noise before defeat.” —
Sun Tzu

q: One must be deeply aware of the impermanence of the world.
h:
“One must be deeply aware of the impermanence of the world.” —
Dogen

q: Success is getting what you want... Happiness is wanting what you get.
h:
“Success is getting what you want... Happiness is wanting what you get.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: We are all self-made, but only the successful will admit it.
h:
“We are all self-made, but only the successful will admit it.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: A fall into a ditch makes you wiser.
h:
“A fall into a ditch makes you wiser.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: I have no methods; all I do is accept people as they are.
h:
“I have no methods; all I do is accept people as they are.” —
Joan Rivers

q: No matter what happens, always be yourself.
h:
“No matter what happens, always be yourself.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Whatever happens always happens on time.
h:
“Whatever happens always happens on time.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Begin now to be what you will be hereafter.
h:
“Begin now to be what you will be hereafter.” —
St. Jerome

q: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
h:
“Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.” —
Epictetus

q: Life is a journey, not a destination.
h:
“Life is a journey, not a destination.” —
Dan Millman

q: Great leaders are almost always great simplifiers, who can cut through argument, debate and doubt, to offer a solution everybody can understand.
h:
“Great leaders are almost always great simplifiers, who can cut through argument, debate and doubt, to offer a solution everybody can understand.” —
Colin Powell

q: Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.
h:
“Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs. ” —
Henry Ford

q: To love means loving the unlovable.
h:
“To love means loving the unlovable.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: There is no value in anything until it is finished.
h:
“There is no value in anything until it is finished. ” —
Genghis Khan

q: A man who cannot tolerate small misfortunes can never accomplish great things.
h:
“A man who cannot tolerate small misfortunes can never accomplish great things.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
h:
“With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.
h:
“Successful people ask better questions, and as a result, they get better answers.” —
Tony Robbins

q: The world is a puzzle; no need to make sense out of it.
h:
“The world is a puzzle; no need to make sense out of it.” —
Socrates

q: It's not what you've got; it's what you do that makes the difference.
h:
“It's not what you've got; it's what you do that makes the difference.” —
Celestine Chua

q: The person who says something is impossible should not interrupt the person who is doing it.
h:
“The person who says something is impossible should not interrupt the person who is doing it.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.
h:
“A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.” —
Judy Garland

q: All you need is passion. If you have a passion for something, you'll create the talent.
h:
“All you need is passion. If you have a passion for something, you'll create the talent.” —
Yanni

q: To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.
h:
“To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived. This is to have succeeded.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.
h:
“Respect other people's feelings. It might mean nothing to you, but it could mean everything to them.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Fear of death is fear of the Unknown.
h:
“Fear of death is fear of the Unknown.” —
Adi Da Samraj

q: I believe that one of life's greatest risks is never daring to risk.
h:
“I believe that one of life's greatest risks is never daring to risk.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: He who knows how to wait need make no concessions.
h:
“He who knows how to wait need make no concessions.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: If you're waiting until you feel talented enough to make it, you'll never make it.
h:
“If you're waiting until you feel talented enough to make it, you'll never make it.” —
Criss Jami

q: In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different.
h:
“In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different.” —
Coco Chanel
